Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2017 05:03PM Jagger2015 wrote: Deda...I also developed a seroma after surgery (6 months ago) which was also the size of a golf ball. I was told by my surgeon to do nothing...it would be absorbed by my body in time. Well....it has gotten much larger, flatter, and hard. It is quite painful and most of my breast and lately under my arm feels hard, lumpy. Not sure who to talk to...my surgeon, oncologist, or radiation oncologist?do you feel better now that you e had surgery
Posts.Title: Post-Lumpectomy Massive Fluid Leakage and Infection! Daisey4522 Daisey4522
